ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 466 (Lament and other newbie question s)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ... Lament is a great song, you will still be using it long after 10th level.  I use it quite often at 18th and my group laments (doh, the regular
ygData.messageBody:
> The lament song will be a good one for in about 2 more levels
> and then up.

>Not to pick on your grammar, Sylly, but I'm not sure what you meant right
>there. Are you saying it won't do me much good until 2 more levels (level
>10) and then it will always be a keeper? Or are you saying after level 10
I
>won't use it much?

Lament is a great song, you will still be using it long after 10th level. I
use it quite often at 18th and my group laments (doh, the regular non-magic
kind) when I am not around to play it cause they can't handle 3 of the
things we usually can get one at a time when I am there.

> At your age you can be hunting the first and mid parts of
> BlackBurrow Paw.

>Hmm, I'd been liking West Karana. Room to run, less lag. I'll have to
>check out Paw though. Can't stand Blackburrow. Is the loot in Paw similar
>to that in BB?

Far better Loot in Paw than Blackburrow. I too hated Blackburrow until I
made 10th level when the trash gnolls started to ignore me.

> can get Menkes Tolbet in South Qeynos to make you Snake Fang
> Necklaces and
> re-sell those in the snake places in east commonlands for 1
> to 2pp. Their
> value goes way up when your buyer is sitting there with the
> poison icon on
> his screen <eg>

>THANK YOU!! I thought I needed a cleric to cure poison. This is very good
>to know.

Don't get too excited they only give a bonus to poison resistance. You can
get a bracelet with 14 charges of cure poison from a Quest in Misty Thicket
though. I have gone thru 3 of these to date and am on my 4th.

>Rokenn wrote:
> NPC's near Surefall
> Glade (Baobob and Chanda Miller). They will
> make wolf and bear hide armor
> items that are usuable by the caster class.

>Aaaahhh!!! I've been selling those pelts!! Of course, on Tunare, the
>Millers' life expectancies are about 3 seconds anyway...

I had that problem too, but the campers agreed to let me speak to the
millers before they killed them.

>Hmm, I was under the impression you had to keep them within the songs range
>and keep lament in your mix of songs. Guess not. So, let's say I lament a
>blue mob, pull a white mob off to the side & kill it, then decide to leave
>the blue mob alone. When the lament wears off, am I on it's hate list?
And
>if I am, will it come across a zone to find me?

Nope, if Lament succeeds you do not get on its hate list. Also many times
when it is resisted you still do not get on its hate list.

> I just WISH her lull lined worked as effectively as lament
> has for me since
> the day I got it.

>So if lament is really that great, why are you higher level folks always
>arguing about whether crowd control is best done with Lullaby, Chain, or
>Charm? Is it just that they hit multiple mobs at once? Or are they better
>than Lament even for single mobs?

Lament only works before a mob is after you. It has no effect on a mob who
already has you in its sights, whereas Lullaby will put those mobs that are
running after you to sleep. Lament is a before combat spell, Lullaby is a
during combat spell for the most part.

Kitasi
